intro: Chuquiraga doniana var. velutina, commonly known as the velvet chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or arid soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
